title: 820-00244 no power
message:
Good morning, this mac has no sign of oxidation. It does not energize through the USB-c, I tried to connect through the source, the signal "connect the charger" appears, but when connecting it does not turn on.
CPU does not heat up. I imagine that u3100 is defective.

L6995 OK;
F7040 OK;
PPBUS_G3H 80mV;

u3100 diode mode
PPBUS_G3H - 0.420 
PPVBUS_LIO - 0.190
PP1V8_SUS - 0.430 
PP3V3_UPC_VIN - 0.586 
PP5V_S4 - 0.360 
PP3V3_S4 - 0.471 
PP3V3_UPC_XA_LDO - 0.512 
PPDCIN_G3H - 0.565 
P1V2S5SW_HSMUX_EN - 0.812 
PP1V8D_UPC_XA_LDO - 0.489

title: 820-00244 no power
message:
"I tried to connect through the source, the signal "connect the charger" appears, but when connecting it does not turn on"
I'm sure many other people on the forum can NOT really understand what you've wanted to say!!!

Do you get any voltage at R7020?
Check voltage and diode mode at [B][U]ALL[/U][/B] LDO rails of U3100.

title: 820-00244 no power
message:
U3100                                          Voltage / diode mode
2 PP1V8D_UPC_XA_LDO              0V / 0.488
35 PP1V1_UPC_XA_LDO_BMC     0.15V / 0.521
53 PP3V3_UPC_XA_LDO               0V / 0.509
75 PP1V8A_UPC_XA_LDO             0V / 0.527

R7020 0V on ALL pins.

title: 820-00244 no power
message:
F3050 - 0.2 Ω / 0V.
How do I know if this jack power connector is good?

title: 820-00244 no power
message:
You must check continuity from USB-C port to the board.
Diode mode to ground at F3050?

title: 820-00244 no power
message: If the fuse is good, then check continuity, as above mentioned.

title: 820-00244 no power
message: Have you tried a new USB-C port assembly?...Common for those to fail on this model, and will typically present in the way you're describing. Also make sure your trackpad/cable and battery are both good.
